history.proof: intros H. destruct H as [H1 [H2 [H3 H4]]]. qsimpl time: 1 use: opp_unicity. qsimpl time: 1 use: opp_unicity. qsimpl time: 1 use: opp_unicity. hauto lq: on depth: 3use: opp_unicity.

exceptions.exn: In environment S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S H1 : intern S G Add H2 : associativity S Add H3 : neutral S G Add O H4 : opposite S G Add O Opp Unable to unify "Opp O = Opp O" with "Opp O = O".

In environment S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S H : is_group -> forall x y : S, is_opposite S G Add O x y -> y = Opp x H1 : intern S G Add H2 : associativity S Add H4 : opposite S G Add O Opp H0 : G O H3 : forall x : S, G x -> Add O x = x H5 : forall x : S, G x -> Add x O = x Unable to unify "?M2226 = Opp ?M2225" with "Opp O = O".

In environment S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S H6 : is_group -> forall x y : S, is_opposite S G Add O x y -> y = Opp x H1 : intern S G Add H2 : associativity S Add H4 : opposite S G Add O Opp H0 : G O H3 : forall x : S, G x -> Add O x = x H5 : forall x : S, G x -> Add x O = x Unable to unify "O" with "Opp O".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
S: Set
G: S -> Prop
Add: S -> S -> S
O: S
Opp: S -> S

Goal:
is_group -> Opp O = O

Premises:
is_group = intern S G Add /\ associativity S Add /\ neutral S G Add O /\ opposite S G Add O Opp : Prop
projT2_of_sigT2_eq : forall p : ?u = ?v, eq_rect (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 ?u)) (fun a : ?A => ?P a) (projT2 (sigT_of_sigT2 ?u)) (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 ?v)) (projT1_of_sigT2_eq p) = projT2 (sigT_of_sigT2 ?v) where ?A : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- Type] ?P : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- ?A -> Type] ?Q : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S O : S Opp : S -> S |- ?A -> Type] ?u : [S : Set G : S -> Prop Add : S -> S ->...-> S |- {a : ?A & ?P a & ?Q a}]
opp_unicity : is_group -> forall x y : S, is_opposite S G Add O x y -> y = Opp x
opp_add : is_group -> commutativity S Add -> forall x y : S, G x -> G y -> Opp (Add x y) = Add (Opp x) (Opp y)
is_opposite : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> S -> S -> Prop
neutral : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> Prop
opposite : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> (S -> S) -> Prop
intern : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
commutativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
associativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments Datatypes.S _%nat_scope
add_add : commutativity S Add -> associativity S Add -> forall x1 y1 x2 y2 : S, Add (Add x1 y1) (Add x2 y2) = Add (Add x1 x2) (Add y1 y2)
opp_opp : is_group -> forall x : S, G x -> x = Opp (Opp x)
regular_l : is_group -> forall y z : S, G y -> G z -> forall x : S, G x -> Add x y = Add x z -> y = z
BinNat.N.eqf = fun f g : BinNums.N -> bool => forall n : BinNums.N, f n = g n : (BinNums.N -> bool) -> (BinNums.N -> bool) -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
BinNat.N.lcm_unique : forall n m p : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le BinNums.N0 p -> BinNat.N.divide n p -> BinNat.N.divide m p -> (forall q : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.divide n q -> BinNat.N.divide m q -> BinNat.N.divide p q) -> BinNat.N.lcm n m = p
Field_theory.gen_phiPOS_inj : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Setoid.Setoid_Theory R req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> (forall x y : R, req (radd rI x) (radd rI y) -> req x y) -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, ~ req (InitialRing.gen_phiPOS1 rI radd rmul p) rO) -> forall x y : BinNums.positive, req (InitialRing.gen_phiPOS rI radd rmul x) (InitialRing.gen_phiPOS rI radd rmul y) -> x = y
Ring_theory.SRIDmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> forall reqb : R -> R -> bool, (forall x y : R, reqb x y = true -> req x y) -> Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul (Ring_theory.SRsub radd) (Ring_theory.SRopp (R:=R)) req rO rI radd rmul (Ring_theory.SRsub radd) (Ring_theory.SRopp (R:=R)) reqb (Ring_theory.IDphi (R:=R))
Field_theory.gen_phiN_inj : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Setoid.Setoid_Theory R req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> (forall x y : R, req (radd rI x) (radd rI y) -> req x y) -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, ~ req (InitialRing.gen_phiPOS1 rI radd rmul p) rO) -> forall x y : BinNums.N, req (InitialRing.gen_phiN rO rI radd rmul x) (InitialRing.gen_phiN rO rI radd rmul y) -> x = y
BinNat.N.log2_bits_unique : forall a n : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.testbit a n = true -> (forall m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.lt n m -> BinNat.N.testbit a m = false) -> BinNat.N.log2 a = n
Ring_theory.mkRmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul : C -> C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), req (phi cO) rO -> req (phi cI) rI -> (forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y))) -> (forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y))) -> (forall x y : C, ceqb x y = true -> req (phi x) (phi y)) -> Ring_theory.semi_morph rO rI radd rmul req cO cI cadd cmul ceqb phi
Ring_theory.mkmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), req (phi cO) rO -> req (phi cI) rI -> (forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y))) -> (forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y))) ->...-> Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi
InitialRing.gen_phiN : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> BinNums.N -> R
InitialRing.gen_phiPOS1 : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> BinNums.positive -> R
InitialRing.gen_phiPOS : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> BinNums.positive -> R
Between.in_int = fun p q r : nat => p <= r < q : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Between.in_int (_ _ _)%nat_scope

```coq
intros H.
destruct H as [H1 [H2 [H3 H4]]].
apply opp_unicity with (x:=O) (y:=Opp O).
- apply H.
- split; auto.
Qed.```

original: intros H. destruct H as [H1 [H2 [H3 H4]]]. apply opp_unicity with (x:=O) (y:=Opp O). - apply H. - split; auto.
